questions.question: A typical 1950s computer probably would be unable to:

choices.answer: Calculate the volume of a lake
Connect to a network
Help determine the speed of Earth's spin
Process sales data

questions.question: What new feature did the PDP-1 have that made Spacewar! possible?

choices.answer: A hard drive
A full-sized keyboard
A laser printer
A graphic display

questions.question: Phone phreakers were driven mainly by:

choices.answer: Curiosity
Greed
Selflessness
Competitiveness

questions.question: Which word best describes the Homebrew Club of the early 1970s?

choices.answer: Political
Hobbyist
Academic
Philanthropic

questions.question: ARPANET was built to help people do things like:

choices.answer: Sort through census data
Move troops around the country
Track the movement of distant galaxies
Connect with friends all over the world

questions.question: Which of the following people would most likely be described as a "black hat?"

choices.answer: A hacker who gathers credit card information
A person who teaches herself to code
A student programmer who snuck around MIT in the sixties
A programmer who designs web sites anonymously

questions.question: Why might a bank hire a "white hat?"

choices.answer: To design an easier to use phone app
To calculate their projected profits for the upcoming year
To teach their employees how to better use the Internet
To protect their database from unauthorized access

questions.question: Which literary character would hacktivists most likely compare themselves to?

choices.answer: Cinderella
Robin Hood
The Wicked Witch
The Big Bad Wolf

questions.question: Which of these statements is most accurate?

choices.answer: Hackers include only those who steal and vandalize
Hacking can be constructive or destructive
Only white hats are true hackers
The difference btwn white & black hats is matter of opinion
Black hats work on ways to break into systems
White hats trade ideas on improving system security
Hacktivists spread their message to media outlets
Programmers test their skills through competition
